* Iron glared at Iris, even though she was also angry at Prowl.*

" What's done is done."

* She grabbed Iris's cape and pulled her old friend back away from Prowl. 
For fear of them taring eachother's throats out.*

" The ones who did the wrongs have to live with those mistakes the rest of 
their lives.  The fact they had done anything wrong is punishment enough. 
They don't need anyone to pick on them for it."

* Iris grabbed her cape back from Iron, sighing but giving Prowl a dirty 
look.*

Iris: " And we know just WHO made the mistakes here."

* Iron only shook her head and walked over to Prowl, leaving Iris to go off 
on her own in a huff.
But IR walked to Prowl, finding that any anger she'd felt towards him had 
cooled down to be replaced by an empty feeling.  Though she felt love for 
him, even though this city made her feel useless.
< Wars aren't suposed to be happy. They don't care about feelings, just as 
long as one side trys to win over the other.>
So, in short, war stepped on a lot of peoples toes.*

" Just ignore her."

* Iron set a hand on Prowls arm and looked into his eyes, putting on a 
smile.*

" And tell me who this Cyndro is."
